00020 #ifndef CONSTRAINT_GACTABLE_NIGHTINGALE_H
00021 #define CONSTRAINT_GACTABLE_NIGHTINGALE_H
00022 
00023 struct TupleComparator
00024 {
00025   int significantIndex;
00026   int arity;
00027   
00028   TupleComparator(int i, int a) : significantIndex(i), arity(a)
00029   { }
00030   
00031   // returns tuple1 <= tuple2 under our ordering.
00032   bool operator()(const vector<int>& tuple1, const vector<int>& tuple2)
00033   {
00034     if(tuple1[significantIndex] != tuple2[significantIndex])
00035       return tuple1[significantIndex] < tuple2[significantIndex];
00036     for(int tupleIndex = 0; tupleIndex < arity; tupleIndex++)
00037     {
00038       if(tuple1[tupleIndex] != tuple2[tupleIndex])
00039         return tuple1[tupleIndex] < tuple2[tupleIndex];
00040     }
00041     return false;
00042   }
00043 };
00044 
00045 struct TupleN
00046 {
00047   // tuple class for nightingale's
00048   int id;  // global array index (can also be used for lex comparison of two tuples.)
00049            // no need for nextPointer
00050   
00051   int * values;
00052   int * nextDifferent;    // int index into global array, pointing to the next 
00053   
00054   TupleN(int * _values, int _id, int arity, int* _nD) : 
00055     id(_id), values(_values), nextDifferent(_nD)
00056   {
00057     for(int i = 0; i < arity; i++)
00058       nextDifferent[i] = -1;
00059   }
00060   
00061   TupleN() : id(-1), values(NULL), nextDifferent(NULL)
00062   { }
00063 };
00064 
00065 #ifdef LISTPERLIT
00066 #define listperliteral true
00067 #else
00068 #define listperliteral false
00069 #endif
00070   
00071 struct Nightingale
00072 {
00073 
00075   int literal_num;
00076   
00077   TupleN * tuplelist;
00078   TupleN *** tuplelistperlit;
00079   
00080   int ** tuplelistlengths;
00081 
00082   int noTuples;
00083   int arity;
00084 
00085   TupleList* tuples;
00086   Nightingale(TupleList* _tuples) : tuples(_tuples)
00087   {
00088     tuples->finalise_tuples();
00089     
00090     arity = tuples->tuple_size();   
00091     noTuples = tuples->size();
00092     if(listperliteral)
00093     {
00094       tuplelistperlit=new TupleN**[arity];
00095       
00096       vector<vector<vector<vector<int> > > > goods;
00097       // Pass goods to splittuples just to avoid copying it on return.
00098       splittuples(tuples, goods);
00099       tuplelistlengths = new int*[arity];
00100       
00101       for(int i = 0; i < arity; i++)
00102       {
00103         int varmin = (tuples->dom_smallest)[i];
00104         int varmax = (tuples->dom_smallest)[i] + (tuples->dom_size)[i];
00105         int domsize = (tuples->dom_size)[i];
00106         tuplelistperlit[i]=new TupleN*[domsize];
00107         tuplelistlengths[i]=new int[domsize];
00108         
00109         for(int val = varmin; val < varmax; val++)
00110         {   
00111           TupleN* tlpl=buildhologram(goods[i][val-varmin]);
00112           tuplelistperlit[i][val-varmin]=tlpl;
00113           tuplelistlengths[i][val-varmin]=goods[i][val-varmin].size();
00114         }
00115       }
00116     }
00117     else
00118     {
00119       tuplelist = buildhologram(*tuples);
00120     }  
00121   }
00122   
00123   void printhologram(TupleN* tlpl, int size)
00124   {
00125     for(int i = 0; i < size; ++i)
00126     {
00127       for(int j = 0; j < arity; ++j)
00128         printf("%d,",tlpl[i].values[j]);
00129       printf("\n");
00130       
00131       for(int j = 0; j < arity; ++j)
00132         printf("%d,",tlpl[i].nextDifferent[j]);
00133       printf("\n\n");     
00134     }
00135   }
00136     
00137   template<typename T>
00138   TupleN* buildhologram(T& tupleref)
00139   {
00140     // turn a list of int [] into an n-holo
00141     TupleN* tlist=new TupleN[tupleref.size()];
00142     
00143     int* mem_block = new int[arity * 2 * tupleref.size()];
00144     for(int tupleIndex = 0; tupleIndex < tupleref.size(); tupleIndex++)
00145     {
00146       int* _values = mem_block + arity * (tupleIndex * 2) ;
00147       
00148       // This line is messy, but is here because we want this code to work
00149       // for both vector<vector<int> >s and tuple containers. I'll clean it up
00150       // sometime.
00151       std::copy(&tupleref[tupleIndex][0], &tupleref[tupleIndex][0] + arity, _values);
00152       
00153       tlist[tupleIndex] = TupleN(_values, tupleIndex, arity,
00154                                  mem_block + arity * (tupleIndex * 2 + 1) );
00155       // Now iterate backwards through the tuplelist, setting the appropriate forward pointers
00156       int numproc=arity;
00157       
00158       // check how many are the same for the last tuple.
00159       if(tupleIndex>=1)
00160       {
00161         for(int valIndex=0; valIndex<arity; valIndex++)
00162         {
00163           if(_values[valIndex]==tlist[tupleIndex-1].values[valIndex])
00164             numproc--;
00165         }
00166       }
00167       
00168       for(int i = tupleIndex - 1; i >= 0; i--)
00169       {
00170         TupleN* backtuple = &tlist[i];
00171         // if backtuple has a value i which is different to curtuple, make the forward link.
00172         
00173         // fill in any entries in nextDifferent
00174         for(int valIndex = 0; valIndex < arity; valIndex++)
00175         {
00176           if(backtuple->nextDifferent[valIndex]==-1)
00177           {
00178             if(backtuple->values[valIndex]!=_values[valIndex])
00179             {
00180               numproc--;
00181               backtuple->nextDifferent[valIndex]=tupleIndex;
00182               // now iterate backwards and fill in any others in the same column
00183               for(int j = i - 1; j >= 0; j--)
00184               {
00185                 if(tlist[j].nextDifferent[valIndex]==-1)
00186                   tlist[j].nextDifferent[valIndex]=tupleIndex;
00187                 else
00188                   break;
00189               }
00190             }
00191           }
00192         }
00193         
00194         if(numproc==0)
00195         {
00196           break;  // suspicious about this. 
00197                   //What about 1 1 5, 1 2 5, 1 2 6. var 3, nextD only set for second tuple, not first.
00198         }
00199       }
00200     }
00201     return tlist;
00202   }
00203   
00204   void splittuples(TupleList* tuples, vector<vector<vector<vector<int> > > >& goods)
00205   {
00206     int arity = tuples->tuple_size();   
00207     goods.resize(arity);
00208     for(int var = 0; var < arity; var++)
00209     {
00210       goods[var].resize((tuples->dom_size)[var]);
00211       for(int val = (tuples->dom_smallest)[var];
00212           val <= (tuples->dom_smallest)[var] + (tuples->dom_size)[var]; val++)
00213       {
00214         for(int tupleindex = 0; tupleindex < tuples->size(); tupleindex++)
00215         {
00216           if((*tuples)[tupleindex][var] == val)
00217             goods[var][val-(tuples->dom_smallest)[var]].push_back(tuples->get_vector(tupleindex));
00218         }
00219       }
00220       
00221       int tuple_sum = 0;
00222       for(int i = 0; i < goods[var].size(); ++i)
00223         tuple_sum += goods[var][i].size();
00224       D_ASSERT(tuple_sum == tuples->size());
00225     }
00226   }
00227   
00228 };

00232 template<typename VarArray>
00233 struct GACTableConstraint : public AbstractConstraint
00234 {
00235   virtual string constraint_name()
00236   { return "TableNightingale"; }
00237   
00238   typedef typename VarArray::value_type VarRef;
00239   VarArray vars;
00240   
00242   // This is bad because it might have holes in it, i.e. revints that are not used.
00243   
00244   int ** current_support;
00245 
00247   bool check_tuple(const vector<int>& v)
00248   {
00249     for(unsigned i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i)
00250     {
00251       if(!vars[i].inDomain(v[i]))
00252         return false;
00253     }
00254     return true;
00255   }
00256   
00257   bool check_tuple(int * v)
00258   {
00259     for(unsigned i = 0; i < arity; ++i)
00260     {
00261       if(!vars[i].inDomain(v[i]))
00262         return false;
00263     }
00264     return true;
00265   }
00266   
00267   int comparetuples(int * t1, int * t2)
00268   {
00269     for(int i = 0; i < arity; i++)
00270     {
00271       if(t1[i] > t2[i])
00272         return 1;
00273       if(t1[i] < t2[i])
00274         return -1;
00275     }
00276     return 0;
00277   }
00278 
00279   int arity;
00280   
00281   Nightingale* nightingale;
00282   
00283   GACTableConstraint(const VarArray& _vars, TupleList* tuples) :
00284     vars(_vars)
00285   {
00286       nightingale = tuples->getNightingale();
00287       arity = nightingale->tuples->tuple_size();     
00288       D_ASSERT(_vars.size() == arity);
00289       current_support=new int*[arity];
00290       
00291       for(int i=0; i<arity; i++)
00292       {
00293         current_support[i]= new int[(tuples->dom_size)[i]];
00294         for(int j=0; j<(tuples->dom_size)[i]; j++)
00295           current_support[i][j]=-1;
00296       }
00297   }
00298   
00299   int dynamic_trigger_count()
00300   { return (nightingale->tuples->literal_num) * ( vars.size() - 1) ; }
00301     
00302   TupleN* seekNextSupport(int var, int val)
00303   {
00304     // find a support which conforms to var and val, and the current domains,
00305     // and is after the support in watches unless we reach the end and wrap.
00306     // Else return null.
00307     
00308     int domain_min = (nightingale->tuples->dom_smallest)[var];
00309     int domain_max = domain_min + (nightingale->tuples->dom_size)[var];
00310     if(val >= domain_max)
00311       return 0;
00312     int ltp = current_support[var][val-domain_min];  // watches must be indexed by the actual value.
00313     
00314     int index = ltp; 
00315     if(index == -1)
00316       index=0;
00317     
00318     // select the list to search through.
00319     TupleN * tuplelisthere;
00320     int listlength;
00321     if(listperliteral){
00322       tuplelisthere=nightingale->tuplelistperlit[var][val-domain_min];
00323       listlength=nightingale->tuplelistlengths[var][val-domain_min];
00324     }
00325     else {
00326       tuplelisthere=nightingale->tuplelist;
00327       listlength=nightingale->noTuples;
00328     }
00329     
00330     
00331     while(index<listlength && index!=-1)
00332     {
00333       TupleN& curtuple=tuplelisthere[index];
00334       // iterate from most to least significant digit
00335       // because most sig digit probably allows greatest jump.
00336       // Remember that var gets treated specially, as if its domain is just {val}
00337       
00338       bool matchAll=true;
00339       for(int valIndex=0; valIndex<arity; valIndex++)
00340       {
00341         int curvalue=curtuple.values[valIndex];
00342         
00343         if( (valIndex!=var && !vars[valIndex].inDomain(curvalue)) || 
00344             (valIndex==var && curvalue!=val))
00345         {
00346           matchAll=false;
00347           index=curtuple.nextDifferent[valIndex];
00348           break;
00349         }
00350       }
00351       
00352       if(matchAll)
00353       {
00354         // success
00355         // set watch
00356         current_support[var][val-domain_min]=index;
00357         //System.out.println("Support found:"+new tuple(curtuple.values));
00358         return &curtuple;
00359       }
00360     }
00361     
00362     
00363     index = 0;
00364     
00365     while(index<=ltp && index!=-1)
00366     {
00367       TupleN& curtuple=tuplelisthere[index];
00368       // iterate from most to least significant digit
00369       // because most sig digit probably allows greatest jump.
00370       // Remember that var gets treated specially, as if its domain is just {val}
00371       
00372       bool matchAll=true;
00373       for(int valIndex=0; valIndex<arity; valIndex++)
00374       {
00375         int curvalue=curtuple.values[valIndex];
00376         
00377         if( (valIndex!=var && !vars[valIndex].inDomain(curvalue)) || 
00378             (valIndex==var && curvalue!=val))
00379         {
00380           matchAll=false;
00381           index=curtuple.nextDifferent[valIndex];
00382           break;
00383         }
00384       }
00385       
00386       if(matchAll)
00387       {
00388         // success
00389         // set watch
00390         current_support[var][val-domain_min]=index;
00391         //System.out.println("Support found:"+new tuple(curtuple.values));
00392         return &curtuple;
00393       }
00394     }
00395     return 0;
00396   }
00397   
00398   // Below is shared with regin-lhomme file.
00399   
00400   bool find_new_support(int literal)
00401   {
00402      pair<int,int> varval = nightingale->tuples->get_varval_from_literal(literal);
00403      int var = varval.first;
00404      int val = varval.second;
00405      TupleN* new_support = seekNextSupport(var,val);
00406            
00407      if (new_support == 0)
00408        return false;
00409      else
00410        return true;
00411   }
00412   
00413   virtual void propagate(DynamicTrigger* propagated_trig)
00414   {
00415     PROP_INFO_ADDONE(DynGACTable);
00416     DynamicTrigger* dt = dynamic_trigger_start();
00417     int trigger_pos = propagated_trig - dt;
00418     int propagated_literal = trigger_pos / (vars.size() - 1);
00419     
00420     BOOL is_new_support = find_new_support(propagated_literal);
00421     
00422     pair<int,int> varval = nightingale->tuples->get_varval_from_literal(propagated_literal);
00423     int varIndex = varval.first;
00424     int val = varval.second;
00425     
00426     if(is_new_support)
00427     {
00428       setup_watches(varIndex, val, propagated_literal);
00429     }
00430     else
00431     {
00432       vars[varIndex].removeFromDomain(val);
00433     }
00434   }
00435   
00436   void setup_watches(int var, int val, int lit)
00437   {
00438     int domain_min = (nightingale->tuples->dom_smallest)[var];
00439     int* tuple;
00440     if(!listperliteral)
00441       tuple=nightingale->tuplelist[current_support[var][val-domain_min]].values;
00442     else
00443       tuple=nightingale->tuplelistperlit[var][val-domain_min][current_support[var][val-domain_min]].values;
00444     
00445     DynamicTrigger* dt = dynamic_trigger_start();
00446     
00447     int vars_size = vars.size();
00448     dt += lit * (vars_size - 1);
00449     for(int v = 0; v < vars_size; ++v)
00450     {
00451       if(v != var)
00452       {
00453         vars[v].addDynamicTrigger(dt, DomainRemoval, tuple[v]);
00454         ++dt;
00455       }
00456     }
00457   }
00458   
00459   
00460   virtual void full_propagate()
00461   { 
00462     for(int varIndex = 0; varIndex < vars.size(); ++varIndex) 
00463     {
00464       // Propagate variables so they fit inside domains. This is a minor fix
00465       int tuple_domain_min = (nightingale->tuples->dom_smallest)[varIndex];
00466       int tuple_domain_size = (nightingale->tuples->dom_size)[varIndex];
00467       
00468       vars[varIndex].setMin(tuple_domain_min);
00469       vars[varIndex].setMax(tuple_domain_min + tuple_domain_size);
00470       
00471       if(getState(stateObj).isFailed()) 
00472         return;
00473       
00474       int max = vars[varIndex].getMax();
00475       
00476       for(int i = vars[varIndex].getMin(); i <= max; ++i) 
00477       { 
00478         TupleN* _tuple=seekNextSupport(varIndex, i);
00479         
00480         int sup=current_support[varIndex][i - tuple_domain_min];
00481         //cout <<sup<<endl;
00482         // cout << "    var " << varIndex << " val: " << i << " sup " << sup << " " << endl;
00483         if(_tuple==0)
00484         {
00485           //cout <<"no support found for var:"<<varIndex<< " and val:"<< i <<endl ;
00486           vars[varIndex].removeFromDomain(i);
00487         }
00488         else
00489         {
00490           setup_watches(varIndex, i, nightingale->tuples->get_literal(varIndex, i));
00491         }
00492       }
00493     }
00494     // cout << endl; cout << "  fp: finished finding supports: " << endl ;
00495   }
00496   
00497   virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int v_size)
00498   {
00499     for(unsigned i = 0; i < (nightingale->tuples)->size(); ++i)
00500     {
00501       if( std::equal(v, v + size, (*nightingale->tuples)[i]) )
00502         return true;
00503     }
00504     return false;
00505   }
00506   
00507   virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
00508   { 
00509     vector<AnyVarRef> anyvars;
00510     for(unsigned i = 0; i < vars.size(); ++i)
00511       anyvars.push_back(vars[i]);
00512     return anyvars;
00513   }
00514 };
00515 
00516 
00517 template<typename VarArray>
00518 AbstractConstraint*
00519 GACTableCon(const VarArray& vars, TupleList* tuples)
00520 { return new GACTableConstraint<VarArray>(vars, tuples); }
00521 
00522 inline Nightingale* TupleList::getNightingale()
00523 {
00524   if(nightingale == NULL)
00525     nightingale = new Nightingale(this);
00526   return nightingale;
00527 }
